intro: Leptocarpus ciliaris, commonly known as the coastal sea bean, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Pacific and Indian Oceans. It is a member of the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, bean-like pods that contain seeds. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal soils, often in brackish or saltwater environments. Its leaves are palmately compound, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Leptocarpus ciliaris is adapted to withstand saline conditions and is often found in intertidal zones.
